versos: (kindness) Ephesians 4:32 - "Be kind to one another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, as God in Christ forgave you.";;;
(openeth) Psalm 145:16 - "Thou openest thine hand, and satisfiest the desire of every living thing.";;;
(healed) Isaiah 53:5 - "But he was pierced for our transgressions, he was crushed for our iniquities; the punishment that brought us peace was on him, and by his wounds we are healed.";;;
(visited) Luke 1:68 - "Blessed be the Lord God of Israel; for he hath visited and redeemed his people,";;;
(suck) "Thou shalt suck the milk of the Gentiles, and shalt suck the breast of kings." - Isaiah 60:16 KJV;;;
(weaned) Isaiah 28:9 - "Whom shall he teach knowledge and whom shall he make to understand doctrine them that are weaned from the milk, and drawn from the breasts.";;;
(lotan) There isn't a verse in the Bible that mentions the word "lotan.";;;
(shobal) 1 Chronicles 2:50 - "These were the descendants of Caleb.";;;
(lad) Genesis 22:6 - "So Abraham took the wood of the burnt offering and laid it on Isaac his son; and he took the fire in his hand, and a knife, and the two of them went together.";;;

(bottle) Jeremiah 13:12 - "Therefore thou shalt speak unto them this word; Thus saith the Lord God of Israel, Every bottle shall be filled with wine: and they shall say unto thee, Do we not certainly know that every bottle shall be filled with wine";;;
(putting) 1 Timothy 4:14 - Do not neglect your gift
(shoulder) Isaiah 9:6 - For to us a child is born
(wandered) Isaiah 53:6 - "We all, like sheep, have gone astray, each of us has turned to our own way; and the Lord has laid on him the iniquity of us all.";;;
(spent) Luke 15:14 - "After he had spent everything, there was a severe famine in that whole country, and he began to be in need.";;;

(swear) James 5:12 - "Above all, my brothers and sisters, do not swearnot by heaven or by earth or by anything else. All you need to say is a simple Yes or No. Anything beyond this comes from the evil one.";;;
(breaketh) Psalm 29:5 - "The voice of the Lord breaketh the cedars; yea, the Lord breaketh the cedars of Lebanon.";;;
(ewe) Leviticus 3:7 - 'If they offer it as an expression of thankfulness
